Adapt to using a non-dominant hand for activities such as opening packages, tying shoelaces, and buttoning clothes.
Practice non-dominant hand writing to improve fine motor skills and muscle memory.
Utilize assistive technology such as voice recognition software or text-to-speech applications to reduce reliance on the non-dominant hand for typing.
Engage in activities that don't require the use of the non-dominant hand, such as swimming or dancing, to compensate for the lack of dexterity.
Consider using a non-dominant hand to hold items such as cups or bowls, which would allow for easier one-handed eating.
